title: Still not sure why we can randomly roll skin perms for champions we don't own tbh.
body:
Currently on a 3 streak of rerolling into skin perms for champs I don't own. First Headhunter Cait, then SKT Lee, now Aristocrat Vayne. Gonna place my bets on some Janna skin or smthn next.

Remind me why this is a feature? You can't get skins for champions you don't own through Mystery Gifts, why the disconnect...?

But therein lies the problem. Not only does Riot not actually care if people "beat the system" as it were, as they've always done so with every other sort of system they could like Dynamic Queue, "Aram-only" accounts, banned players just making new accounts to start over and general Smurfing, but Riot already had a perfectly functioning system in place.

Now that they jumped on the Chest/Key bandwagon 8 years too late, they get to deal with all the inherent problems and frustrations that come with a needless system while ignoring all the advancements and tweaks other games have done to limit some of those very problems.

So let's that a company that is offering "Free cars!" for it's members if they participate in a special program, but the cars are limited to one country only, and you can't choose what car or country.  

Would you participate in that program if you wouldn't receive anything from it?  Sure maybe you would need a car in France one day, but is it really worth your time now to try for that?  And what then do you think of the company that was offering "Free cars!" to it's members when they are really offering "Free cars that may or may not be of use to you anytime in your life!".  That puts a huge stipulation on it and severely limits the use of the prize.

If you are offering a reward that is not worth the effort put in - it's perfectly reasonable to say that the reward is undervalued.  By using your logic we should all give hobos begging for cash pennies because it could be worse!

Your argument makes sense, but the assumptions don't seem to match up with reality.

>If you are offering a reward that is not worth the effort put in - it's perfectly reasonable to say that the reward is undervalued.

This is true. But in reality, the effort put in is essentially 0. You get chests and key frags from just playing the game how you would otherwise, so the only 'effort' is combining the key frags and opening the chest, which is completely negligible.

Therefore, even if the reward was literally nothing, it would be only slightly undervalued. And a free skin that you may use sometime is certainly more than nothing.

your arguement doesn't make sense

They do it that way because Riot doesn't want you substituting the crafting system for actually spending money. If they made it so that you only got stuff for champs you owned, you would be less incentive to buy skins for champs- especially true if you had a very small champion pool. Someone with say, 12 champs owned could get basically every skin available for them fairly easily. 

tldr: greed

I understand that, it's not just greed either.  If they make it too easy to get skins then they would lose a fair amount of income (which goes back into the game and players), but I think it would be nice to be more likely to get skins for champs we own.  I have a Pentakill Yorick shard and a Ace of Spades Ezreal and I don't own either, but I don't want to reroll any other shards because I probably won't own that champ either.

So instead of making it so I can avoid having to pay for anything I end up just seeing the entire crafting thing as useless.

By the way, thanks for that Legendary Tristana skin shard (Dragon Trainer) 2 weeks after I bought it.  I would have preferred damned near anything besides that.  Why can't I just take 3 skin shards that I have no control over and reroll them into a single skin permanent for a champion I do own?

Oh, and if someone only has 12 champs owned, then without buying a chest they could only get 12 chests through the entire season which would not be nearly enough to get all of the skin permanents from rerolling them, and not even enough to get all of the skin SHARDS for those, unless someone was INSANELY lucky.  Oh, and then they still don't have the essence to use them.  So for someone to get all skins for 12 champions through chests alone without buying it would take... 3-4 years with only getting shards/permanents for champions you own?
How is that greed?

I don't understand how you can call that "Greed" unless you yourself have a problem with a Capitalist society (Though that is an entire different conversation)
